title: Ticket #4699: Allow user prio preemption to work on partitionable slots
description:
In 8.2 we added support to allow RANK to preempt multiple pslots via setting knob ALLOW_PSLOT_PREEMPTION=True in the config of the central manager. We now need to add similar support for user prio preemption.

So now with the code added in this ticket ALLOW_PSLOT_PREEMPTION=True works with startd RANK and also PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS for user priority preemption. However, even in v8.7.10, some mechanisms that are known to currently not work as expected in conjunction with pslot preemption are:

  1. PREEMPTION_RANK
  2. MaxVacateTime, so jobs that take a long time to vacate could cause problems on the machine.
  3. concurrency limits
  4. consumption policies
  5. non-fungible custom resources, i.e. resources that cannot be expressed as a number, like GPU device IDs. So dealing with CPU cores, Memory, and Disk should all work, but not GPUs.
  6. Consider early preemption may be an issue?
remarks:
2016-May-03 11:32:42 by tim:
More work needs to be done here.

2016-Oct-17 16:58:25 by tannenba:
So putting a finer point on what more work still remains -

The issue is PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS and PREEMPTION_RANK are still both evaluated in the context of the pslot, not the dslot, so they don't work as expected if they reference attributes about the user who would be preempted. In addition, the special attributes that the negotiator normally adds about the current user/group aren't added for the pslot preemption evaluations.

In the case of PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS, the commits already made to this ticket get us part way there, in that it is evaluated once for each dslot, with an attribute CandidateSlot set so that the expression can consult rolled-up dslot attributes in the pslot. But this requires that the admin write their PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS in a special way that is different for pslots vs static slots, and also requires that the startd does rollup for anything referenced in PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS.

I admit I am wondering if ignoring the rollup info for now, and simply referencing the dslot in the negotiator, would be better for the time being until we think through the rollup mechanism more.

Effort estimate to resolve this ticket is O(2weeks).

2018-May-07 15:22:47 by jfrey:
Code Review (for the most recent changes by Todd Tannenbaum)

  • The map of slot name to ClassAd* can be built once at the start of the negotiation cycle.

  • Setting a bogus RemoteUser attribute should be done for all forms of pslot preemption, not just for user priority.

2018-May-07 16:30:40 by jfrey:
I've pushed changes that address my code review.

2018-May-10 13:52:53 by jfrey:
Code Review

Greg's changes look good.

Todd's changes to clear the MatchList cache look good.

Todd's changes to remove the hard-coded check on priority for user priority preemption has a couple issues:

  • The rejPreemptForPrio count is now meaningless.
  • If a claim takes a while to be preempted (e.g. long retirement time), nothing prevents the negotiator from giving the slot to a different preempting job every negotiation cycle. It could even ping-poing between the same two preempting jobs (or sets of jobs).
